model.chip_description: Product Features • ARM Cortex-M CPU platform • High Performance 32-bit processor • Wake-up Interrupt Controller • Flexible Energy Management System • General Purpose I/O pins • Configurable Push-pull, Open-drain, pull-up/down, input filter, drive strength • Configurable peripheral I/O locations • asynchronous external interrupts • Multi Channel Peripheral Reflex System for autonomous inter-peripheral signaling • Hardware AES • Timers/Counters • Communication interfaces • Universal Synchronous/Asynchronous Receiver/ Transmitter • UART/SPI/SmartCard (ISO 7816)/IrDA • Triple buffered full/half-duplex operation • 4-16 data bits • Universal Asynchronous Receiver/Transmitter • Triple buffered full/half-duplex operation • 8-9 data bits • Low Energy UART • Autonomous operation with DMA in Deep Sleep Mode • I2C Interface with SMBus support • Address recognition in Stop Mode • Ultra low power precision analog peripherals • Ultra efficient Power-on Reset and Brown-Out Detector • 2-pin Serial Wire Debug interface • 1-pin Serial Wire Viewer • Pre-Programmed Serial Bootloader • Temperature range -40 to 85 ºC • Single power supply 1.8 to 3.8 V Copyright Silicon Laboratories, Inc. 2017. All rights reserved. Version 5.2.1

field.name: ADDRFAULTEN

field.name: PWRUPONDEMAND
field.description: Power Up On Demand During Wake Up

field.name: MODE
field.description: Read Mode - Value, Description 0x00, WS0 - Zero wait-states inserted in fetch or read transfers 0x01, WS1 - One wait-state inserted for each fetch or read transfer. See Flash Wait-States table for details 0x02, WS2 - Two wait-states inserted for eatch fetch or read transfer. See Flash Wait-States table for details 0x03, WS3 - Three wait-states inserted for eatch fetch or read transfer. See Flash Wait-States table for details

field.name: ADDRB
field.description: Page Erase or Write Address Buffer

field.name: INVADDR

field.name: ERASEABORTED

field.name: PWRUPCKBDFAILCOUNT

field.name: PWRUPF

field.name: LOCKKEY
field.description: Configuration Lock - Value, Description 0x00, LOCK - 0x00, UNLOCKED - 0x01, LOCKED - 0x01B71, UNLOCK -

field.name: CACHEHITS
field.description: Cache hits since last performance counter start command.

field.name: CACHEMISSES
field.description: Cache misses since last performance counter start command.

field.name: LOCKKEY
field.description: Mass Erase Lock - Value, Description 0x00, LOCK - 0x00, UNLOCKED - 0x01, LOCKED - 0x0631A, UNLOCK -

register.name: BOOTLOADERCTRL
register.description: Bootloader read and write enable, write once register

field.name: CACHELPLEVEL
field.description: Instruction Cache Low-Power Level - Value, Description 0x00, BASE - Base instruction cache functionality. 0x01, ADVANCED - Advanced buffering mode, where the cache uses the fetch pattern to predict highly accessed data and store it in low-energy memory. 0x03, MINACTIVITY - Minimum activity mode, which allows the cache to minimize activity in logic that it predicts has a low probability being used. This mode can introduce wait-states into the instruction fetch stream when the cache exits one of its low-activity states. The number of wait-states introduced is small, but users running with 0-wait-state memory and wishing to reduce the variability that the cache might introduce with additional wait-states may wish to lower the cache low-power level. Note, this mode includes the advanced buffering mode functionality.

field.name: EM01LD
field.description: Reserved for internal use. Do not change.

field.name: EM23VSCALEAUTOWSEN
field.description: Automatically configures Flash, Ram and Frequency to wakeup from EM2 or EM3 at low voltage

field.name: EM23VSCALE

field.name: EM01VSCALE2

field.name: EM4IORETMODE
field.description: EM4 IO Retention Disable - Value, Description 0x00, DISABLE - No Retention: Pads enter reset state when entering EM4 0x01, EM4EXIT - Retention through EM4: Pads enter reset state when exiting EM4 0x02, SWUNLATCH - Retention through EM4 and Wakeup: software writes UNLATCH register to remove retention

field.name: EM4WUEN

field.name: EM23WAKEUP

field.name: LOCKKEY
field.description: Regulator and Supply Configuration Lock Key - Value, Description 0x00, LOCK - 0x00, UNLOCKED - 0x01, LOCKED - 0x0ADE8, UNLOCK -

field.name: REGPWRSEL
field.description: This field selects the input supply pin for the Digital LDO.

field.name: IMMEDIATEPWRSWITCH
field.description: Allows immeditate switching of ANASW and REGPWRSEL bitfields

field.name: DCDCMODE
field.description: Regulator Mode - Value, Description 0x00, BYPASS - DCDC regulator is operating in bypass mode. Prior to configuring DCDCMODE=BYPASS, software must set EMU_DCDCCLIMCTRL.BYPLIMEN=1 to prevent excessive current between VREGVDD and DVDD supplies. 0x01, LOWNOISE - DCDC regulator is operating in low noise mode. 0x02, LOWPOWER - DCDC regulator is operating in low power mode. 0x03, OFF - DCDC regulator is off and the bypass switch is off. Note: DVDD must be supplied externally

field.name: LNFORCECCM

field.name: LPCMPHYSDIS

field.name: LPCMPHYSHI

field.name: LNFORCECCMIMM
field.description: Force DCDC into CCM mode immediately, based on LNFORCECCM

field.name: WDOGRMODE
field.description: WDOG Reset Mode - Value, Description 0x00, DISABLED - Reset request is blocked. This disable bit is redundant with enable/disable bit in WDOG 0x01, LIMITED - The CRYOTIMER, DEBUGGER, RTCC, are not reset. 0x02, EXTENDED - The CRYOTIMER, DEBUGGER are not reset. RTCC is reset. 0x04, FULL - The entire device is reset except some EMU and RMU registers.

field.name: LOCKUPRMODE
field.description: Core LOCKUP Reset Mode - Value, Description 0x00, DISABLED - Reset request is blocked. 0x01, LIMITED - The CRYOTIMER, DEBUGGER, RTCC, are not reset. 0x02, EXTENDED - The CRYOTIMER, DEBUGGER are not reset. RTCC is reset. 0x04, FULL - The entire device is reset except some EMU and RMU registers.

field.name: SYSRMODE
field.description: Core Sysreset Reset Mode - Value, Description 0x00, DISABLED - Reset request is blocked. 0x01, LIMITED - The CRYOTIMER, DEBUGGER, RTCC, are not reset. 0x02, EXTENDED - The CRYOTIMER, DEBUGGER are not reset. RTCC is reset. 0x04, FULL - The entire device is reset except some EMU and RMU registers.

field.name: PINRMODE
field.description: PIN Reset Mode - Value, Description 0x00, DISABLED - Reset request is blocked. 0x01, LIMITED - The CRYOTIMER, DEBUGGER, RTCC, are not reset. 0x02, EXTENDED - The CRYOTIMER, DEBUGGER are not reset. RTCC is reset. 0x04, FULL - The entire device is reset except some EMU and RMU registers.

field.name: DECBOD
field.description: Brown Out Detector Decouple Domain Reset

field.name: LOCKKEY

field.name: CLKOUTSEL0
field.description: Clock Output Select 0 - Value, Description 0x00, DISABLED - Disabled 0x01, ULFRCO - ULFRCO (directly from oscillator) 0x02, LFRCO - LFRCO (directly from oscillator) 0x03, LFXO - LFXO (directly from oscillator) 0x06, HFXO - HFXO (directly from oscillator) 0x07, HFEXPCLK - HFEXPCLK 0x09, ULFRCOQ - ULFRCO (qualified) 0x0A, LFRCOQ - LFRCO (qualified) 0x0B, LFXOQ - LFXO (qualified) 0x0C, HFRCOQ - HFRCO (qualified) 0x0D, AUXHFRCOQ - AUXHFRCO (qualified) 0x0E, HFXOQ - HFXO (qualified) 0x0F, HFSRCCLK - HFSRCCLK 0x010, PLFRCO - PLFRCO (directly from oscillator) 0x011, PLFRCOQ - PLFRCO (qualified)

field.name: CLKOUTSEL1
field.description: Clock Output Select 1 - Value, Description 0x00, DISABLED - Disabled 0x01, ULFRCO - ULFRCO (directly from oscillator) 0x02, LFRCO - LFRCO (directly from oscillator) 0x03, LFXO - LFXO (directly from oscillator) 0x06, HFXO - HFXO (directly from oscillator) 0x07, HFEXPCLK - HFEXPCLK 0x09, ULFRCOQ - ULFRCO (qualified) 0x0A, LFRCOQ - LFRCO (qualified) 0x0B, LFXOQ - LFXO (qualified) 0x0C, HFRCOQ - HFRCO (qualified) 0x0D, AUXHFRCOQ - AUXHFRCO (qualified) 0x0E, HFXOQ - HFXO (qualified) 0x0F, HFSRCCLK - HFSRCCLK 0x010, PLFRCO - PLFRCO (directly from oscillator) 0x011, PLFRCOQ - PLFRCO (qualified)

field.name: WSHFLE
field.description: Wait State for High-Frequency LE Interface

field.name: CLKDIV
field.description: Locally divide HFRCO Clock Output - Value, Description 0x00, DIV1 - Divide by 1. 0x01, DIV2 - Divide by 2. 0x02, DIV4 - Divide by 4.

field.name: VREFTC
field.description: HFRCO Temperature Coefficient Trim on Comparator Reference

field.name: CLKDIV
field.description: Locally divide AUXHFRCO Clock Output - Value, Description 0x00, DIV1 - Divide by 1. 0x01, DIV2 - Divide by 2. 0x02, DIV4 - Divide by 4.

field.name: VREFTC
field.description: AUXHFRCO Temperature Coefficient Trim on Comparator Reference

field.name: VREFUPDATE
field.description: Control Vref update rate - Value, Description 0x00, 32CYCLES - 32 clocks. 0x01, 64CYCLES - 64 clocks. 0x02, 128CYCLES - 128 clocks. 0x03, 256CYCLES - 256 clocks.

field.name: TIMEOUT
field.description: LFRCO Timeout - Value, Description 0x00, 2CYCLES - Timeout period of 2 cycles 0x01, 16CYCLES - Timeout period of 16 cycles 0x02, 32CYCLES - Timeout period of 32 cycles

field.name: PEAKDETSHUNTOPTMODE
field.description: HFXO Automatic Peak Detection and shunt current optimization mode - Value, Description 0x00, AUTOCMD - Automatic control of HFXO peak detection and shunt optimization sequences. CMU_CMD HFXOPEAKDETSTART and HFXOSHUNTOPTSTART can also be used. 0x01, CMD - CMU_CMD HFXOPEAKDETSTART and HFXOSHUNTOPTSTART can be used to trigger peak detection and shunt optimization sequences. 0x02, MANUAL - CMU_HFXOSTEADYSTATECTRL IBTRIMXOCORE, REGISH, REGSELILOW, and PEAKDETEN are under full software control and are allowed to be changed once HFXO is ready.

field.name: LOWPOWER
field.description: Low power mode control. PSR performance is reduced to enable low current consumption.

field.name: XTI2GND
field.description: Clamp HFXTAL_N pin to ground when HFXO oscillator is off.

field.name: XTO2GND
field.description: Clamp HFXTAL_P pin to ground when HFXO oscillator is off.

field.name: LFTIMEOUT
field.description: HFXO Low Frequency Timeout - Value, Description 0x00, 0CYCLES - Timeout period of 0 cycles (disabled) 0x01, 2CYCLES - Timeout period of 2 cycles 0x02, 4CYCLES - Timeout period of 4 cycles 0x03, 16CYCLES - Timeout period of 16 cycles 0x04, 32CYCLES - Timeout period of 32 cycles 0x05, 64CYCLES - Timeout period of 64 cycles 0x06, 1KCYCLES - Timeout period of 1024 cycles 0x07, 4KCYCLES - Timeout period of 4096 cycles

field.name: AUTOSTARTEM0EM1
field.description: Automatically start of HFXO upon EM0/EM1 entry from EM2/EM3

field.name: AUTOSTARTSELEM0EM1
field.description: Automatically start and select of HFXO upon EM0/EM1 entry from EM2/EM3

field.name: IBTRIMXOCORE
field.description: Sets the startup oscillator core bias current. Current (uA) = IBTRIMXOCORE x 40uA. Bits 6 and 5 may only be high in the crystal oscillator startup phase

field.name: CTUNE
field.description: Sets oscillator tuning capacitance. Capacitance on HFXTAL_N and HFXTAL_P (pF) = Ctune = Cpar + CTUNE<8:0> x 40fF. Max Ctune 25pF (CLmax ~12.5pF). CL(DNLmax)=50fF ~ 0.6ppm (12.5ppm/pF)

field.name: IBTRIMXOCORE
field.description: Sets the steady state oscillator core bias current. Current (uA) = IBTRIMXOCORE x 40uA. Bits 6 and 5 may only be high in the crystal oscillator startup phase.

field.name: REGISH
field.description: Sets the steady state regulator output current level (shunt regulator). Ish = 120uA + REGISH x 120uA

field.name: CTUNE
field.description: Sets oscillator tuning capacitance. Capacitance on HFXTAL_N and HFXTAL_P (pF) = Ctune = Cpar + CTUNE<8:0> x 40fF. Max Ctune 25pF (CLmax ~12.5pF). CL(DNLmax)=50fF ~ 0.6ppm (12.5ppm/pF)

field.name: REGSELILOW
field.description: Controls regulator minimum shunt current detection relative to nominal

field.name: REGISHUPPER
field.description: Set regulator output current level (shunt regulator). Ish = 120uA + REGISHUPPER x 120uA

field.name: STARTUPTIMEOUT
field.description: Wait duration in HFXO startup enable wait state - Value, Description 0x00, 2CYCLES - Timeout period of 2 cycles 0x01, 4CYCLES - Timeout period of 4 cycles 0x02, 16CYCLES - Timeout period of 16 cycles 0x03, 32CYCLES - Timeout period of 32 cycles 0x04, 256CYCLES - Timeout period of 256 cycles 0x05, 1KCYCLES - Timeout period of 1024 cycles 0x06, 2KCYCLES - Timeout period of 2048 cycles 0x07, 4KCYCLES - Timeout period of 4096 cycles 0x08, 8KCYCLES - Timeout period of 8192 cycles 0x09, 16KCYCLES - Timeout period of 16384 cycles 0x0A, 32KCYCLES - Timeout period of 32768 cycles

field.name: STEADYTIMEOUT
field.description: Wait duration in HFXO startup steady wait state - Value, Description 0x00, 2CYCLES - Timeout period of 2 cycles 0x01, 4CYCLES - Timeout period of 4 cycles 0x02, 16CYCLES - Timeout period of 16 cycles 0x03, 32CYCLES - Timeout period of 32 cycles 0x04, 256CYCLES - Timeout period of 256 cycles 0x05, 1KCYCLES - Timeout period of 1024 cycles 0x06, 2KCYCLES - Timeout period of 2048 cycles 0x07, 4KCYCLES - Timeout period of 4096 cycles 0x08, 8KCYCLES - Timeout period of 8192 cycles 0x09, 16KCYCLES - Timeout period of 16384 cycles 0x0A, 32KCYCLES - Timeout period of 32768 cycles

field.name: PEAKDETTIMEOUT
field.description: Wait duration in HFXO peak detection wait state - Value, Description 0x00, 2CYCLES - Timeout period of 2 cycles 0x01, 4CYCLES - Timeout period of 4 cycles 0x02, 16CYCLES - Timeout period of 16 cycles 0x03, 32CYCLES - Timeout period of 32 cycles 0x04, 256CYCLES - Timeout period of 256 cycles 0x05, 1KCYCLES - Timeout period of 1024 cycles 0x06, 2KCYCLES - Timeout period of 2048 cycles 0x07, 4KCYCLES - Timeout period of 4096 cycles 0x08, 8KCYCLES - Timeout period of 8192 cycles 0x09, 16KCYCLES - Timeout period of 16384 cycles 0x0A, 32KCYCLES - Timeout period of 32768 cycles

field.name: SHUNTOPTTIMEOUT
field.description: Wait duration in HFXO shunt current optimization wait state - Value, Description 0x00, 2CYCLES - Timeout period of 2 cycles 0x01, 4CYCLES - Timeout period of 4 cycles 0x02, 16CYCLES - Timeout period of 16 cycles 0x03, 32CYCLES - Timeout period of 32 cycles 0x04, 256CYCLES - Timeout period of 256 cycles 0x05, 1KCYCLES - Timeout period of 1024 cycles 0x06, 2KCYCLES - Timeout period of 2048 cycles 0x07, 4KCYCLES - Timeout period of 4096 cycles 0x08, 8KCYCLES - Timeout period of 8192 cycles 0x09, 16KCYCLES - Timeout period of 16384 cycles 0x0A, 32KCYCLES - Timeout period of 32768 cycles

field.name: TUNING
field.description: LFXO Internal Capacitor Array Tuning Value

field.name: MODE
field.description: LFXO Mode - Value, Description 0x00, XTAL - 32768 Hz crystal oscillator 0x01, BUFEXTCLK - An AC coupled buffer is coupled in series with LFXTAL_N pin, suitable for external sinus wave (32768 Hz). 0x02, DIGEXTCLK - Digital external clock on LFXTAL_N pin. Oscillator is effectively bypassed.

field.name: HIGHAMPL
field.description: LFXO High XTAL Oscillation Amplitude Enable

field.name: TIMEOUT
field.description: LFXO Timeout - Value, Description 0x00, 2CYCLES - Timeout period of 2 cycles 0x01, 256CYCLES - Timeout period of 256 cycles 0x02, 1KCYCLES - Timeout period of 1024 cycles 0x03, 2KCYCLES - Timeout period of 2048 cycles 0x04, 4KCYCLES - Timeout period of 4096 cycles 0x05, 8KCYCLES - Timeout period of 8192 cycles 0x06, 16KCYCLES - Timeout period of 16384 cycles 0x07, 32KCYCLES - Timeout period of 32768 cycles

field.name: REFSEL
field.description: Reference Clock Selection Control - Value, Description 0x00, HFXO - HFXO selected 0x01, LFXO - LFXO selected 0x03, CLKIN0 - CLKIN0 selected

field.name: UPSEL
field.description: Calibration Up-counter Select - Value, Description 0x00, HFXO - Select HFXO as up-counter 0x01, LFXO - Select LFXO as up-counter 0x02, HFRCO - Select HFRCO as up-counter 0x03, LFRCO - Select LFRCO as up-counter 0x04, AUXHFRCO - Select AUXHFRCO as up-counter 0x05, PRS - Select PRS input selected by PRSUPSEL as up-counter 0x08, PLFRCO - Select PLFRCO as up-counter

field.name: DOWNSEL
field.description: Calibration Down-counter Select - Value, Description 0x00, HFCLK - Select HFCLK for down-counter 0x01, HFXO - Select HFXO for down-counter 0x02, LFXO - Select LFXO for down-counter 0x03, HFRCO - Select HFRCO for down-counter 0x04, LFRCO - Select LFRCO for down-counter 0x05, AUXHFRCO - Select AUXHFRCO for down-counter 0x06, PRS - Select PRS input selected by PRSDOWNSEL as down-counter 0x09, PLFRCO - Select PLFRCO for down-counter

field.name: PRSUPSEL
field.description: PRS Select for PRS Input when selected in UPSEL - Value, Description 0x00, PRSCH0 - PRS Channel 0 selected as input 0x01, PRSCH1 - PRS Channel 1 selected as input 0x02, PRSCH2 - PRS Channel 2 selected as input 0x03, PRSCH3 - PRS Channel 3 selected as input 0x04, PRSCH4 - PRS Channel 4 selected as input 0x05, PRSCH5 - PRS Channel 5 selected as input 0x06, PRSCH6 - PRS Channel 6 selected as input 0x07, PRSCH7 - PRS Channel 7 selected as input 0x08, PRSCH8 - PRS Channel 8 selected as input 0x09, PRSCH9 - PRS Channel 9 selected as input 0x0A, PRSCH10 - PRS Channel 10 selected as input 0x0B, PRSCH11 - PRS Channel 11 selected as input

field.name: PRSDOWNSEL
field.description: PRS Select for PRS Input when selected in DOWNSEL - Value, Description 0x00, PRSCH0 - PRS Channel 0 selected as input 0x01, PRSCH1 - PRS Channel 1 selected as input 0x02, PRSCH2 - PRS Channel 2 selected as input 0x03, PRSCH3 - PRS Channel 3 selected as input 0x04, PRSCH4 - PRS Channel 4 selected as input 0x05, PRSCH5 - PRS Channel 5 selected as input 0x06, PRSCH6 - PRS Channel 6 selected as input 0x07, PRSCH7 - PRS Channel 7 selected as input 0x08, PRSCH8 - PRS Channel 8 selected as input 0x09, PRSCH9 - PRS Channel 9 selected as input 0x0A, PRSCH10 - PRS Channel 10 selected as input 0x0B, PRSCH11 - PRS Channel 11 selected as input

field.name: DBG
field.description: Debug Trace Clock - Value, Description 0x00, AUXHFRCO - AUXHFRCO is the debug trace clock 0x01, HFCLK - HFCLK is the debug trace clock

register.name: HFCLKSEL
register.description: High Frequency Clock Select Command Register

field.name: HF
field.description: HFCLK Select - Value, Description 0x01, HFRCO - Select HFRCO as HFCLK 0x02, HFXO - Select HFXO as HFCLK 0x03, LFRCO - Select LFRCO as HFCLK 0x04, LFXO - Select LFXO as HFCLK 0x05, HFRCODIV2 - Select HFRCO divided by 2 as HFCLK 0x07, CLKIN0 - Select CLKIN0 as HFCLK

register.name: LFACLKSEL
register.description: Low Frequency A Clock Select Register

field.name: LFA
field.description: Clock Select for LFA - Value, Description 0x00, DISABLED - LFACLK is disabled 0x01, LFRCO - LFRCO selected as LFACLK 0x02, LFXO - LFXO selected as LFACLK 0x04, ULFRCO - ULFRCO selected as LFACLK 0x05, PLFRCO - PLFRCO selected as LFACLK

register.name: LFBCLKSEL
register.description: Low Frequency B Clock Select Register

field.name: LFB
field.description: Clock Select for LFB - Value, Description 0x00, DISABLED - LFBCLK is disabled 0x01, LFRCO - LFRCO selected as LFBCLK 0x02, LFXO - LFXO selected as LFBCLK 0x03, HFCLKLE - HFCLK divided by two/four is selected as LFBCLK 0x04, ULFRCO - ULFRCO selected as LFBCLK 0x05, PLFRCO - PLFRCO selected as LFBCLK

register.name: LFECLKSEL
register.description: Low Frequency E Clock Select Register

field.name: LFE
field.description: Clock Select for LFE - Value, Description 0x00, DISABLED - LFECLK is disabled 0x01, LFRCO - LFRCO selected as LFECLK 0x02, LFXO - LFXO selected as LFECLK 0x04, ULFRCO - ULFRCO selected as LFECLK 0x05, PLFRCO - PLFRCO selected as LFECLK

field.name: HFXOREQ
field.description: HFXO is Required by Hardware (e.g. RAC)

field.name: HFXOAMPHIGH
field.description: HFXO oscillation amplitude is too high

field.name: HFXOAMPLOW
field.description: HFXO amplitude tuning value too low

field.name: HFXOREGILOW
field.description: HFXO regulator shunt current too low

field.name: SELECTED
field.description: HFCLK Selected - Value, Description 0x01, HFRCO - HFRCO is selected as HFCLK clock source 0x02, HFXO - HFXO is selected as HFCLK clock source 0x03, LFRCO - LFRCO is selected as HFCLK clock source 0x04, LFXO - LFXO is selected as HFCLK clock source 0x05, HFRCODIV2 - HFRCO divided by 2 is selected as HFCLK clock source 0x07, CLKIN0 - CLKIN0 is selected as HFCLK clock source

field.name: IBTRIMXOCORE
field.description: Value of IBTRIMXOCORE found by automatic HFXO peak detection algorithm. Can be used as initial value for IBTRIMXOCORE in the CMU_HFXOSTEADYSTATECTRL register if HFXO is to be started again.

field.name: REGISH
field.description: Value of REGISH found by automatic HFXO shunt current optimization algorithm. Can be used as initial value for REGISH value in the CMU_HFXOSTEADYSTATECTRL register if HFXO is to be started again.

field.name: HFXOPEAKDETERR
field.description: HFXO Automatic Peak Detection Error Interrupt Flag

field.name: HFXOPEAKDETRDY
field.description: HFXO Automatic Peak Detection Ready Interrupt Flag

field.name: HFXOSHUNTOPTRDY
field.description: HFXO Automatic Shunt Current Optimization Ready Interrupt Flag

field.name: LFTIMEOUTERR
field.description: Low Frequency Timeout Error Interrupt Flag

field.name: DPLLLOCKFAILLOW
field.description: DPLL Lock Failure Low Interrupt Flag

field.name: DPLLLOCKFAILHIGH
field.description: DPLL Lock Failure Low Interrupt Flag

field.name: PLFRCOHFXODNSERR
field.description: Error due to HFXO not starting Interrupt Flag

field.name: LFXOEDGE
field.description: LFXO Clock Edge Detected Interrupt Flag

field.name: LFRCOEDGE
field.description: LFRCO Clock Edge Detected Interrupt Flag

field.name: ULFRCOEDGE
field.description: ULFRCO Clock Edge Detected Interrupt Flag

field.name: PLFRCOEDGE
field.description: PLFRCO Clock Edge Detected Interrupt Flag

register.name: HFBUSCLKEN0
register.description: High Frequency Bus Clock Enable Register 0

field.description: Advanced Encryption Standard Accelerator 0 Clock Enable

field.name: CRYPTO1
field.description: Advanced Encryption Standard Accelerator 1 Clock Enable

field.name: LE
field.description: Low Energy Peripheral Interface Clock Enable

field.name: LDMA
field.description: Linked Direct Memory Access Controller Clock Enable

register.name: HFPERCLKEN0
register.description: High Frequency Peripheral Clock Enable Register 0

field.name: ADC0
field.description: Analog to Digital Converter 0 Clock Enable

field.name: VDAC0
field.description: Digital to Analog Converter 0 Clock Enable

field.name: CSEN
field.description: Capacitive touch sense module Clock Enable

field.name: IDAC0
field.description: Current Digital to Analog Converter 0 Clock Enable

field.name: TRNG0
field.description: True Random Number Generator 0 Clock Enable

register.description: Low Frequency A Clock Enable Register 0 (Async Reg)

field.name: LESENSE
field.description: Low Energy Sensor Interface Clock Enable

register.name: LFBCLKEN0
register.description: Low Frequency B Clock Enable Register 0 (Async Reg)

field.name: CSEN
field.description: Capacitive touch sense module Clock Enable

register.name: LFECLKEN0
register.description: Low Frequency E Clock Enable Register 0 (Async Reg)

field.name: RTCC
field.description: Real-Time Counter and Calendar Clock Enable

field.name: HFCLKLEPRESC
field.description: HFCLKLE prescaler - Value, Description 0x00, DIV2 - HFCLKLE is HFBUSCLKLE divided by 2. 0x01, DIV4 - HFCLKLE is HFBUSCLKLE divided by 4.

register.name: HFCOREPRESC
register.description: High Frequency Core Clock Prescaler Register

register.name: HFPERPRESC
register.description: High Frequency Peripheral Clock Prescaler Register

register.name: HFEXPPRESC
register.description: High Frequency Export Clock Prescaler Register

register.name: LFAPRESC0
register.description: Low Frequency A Prescaler Register 0 (Async Reg)

field.name: LETIMER0
field.description: Low Energy Timer 0 Prescaler - Value, Description 0x00, DIV1 - LFACLKLETIMER0 = LFACLK 0x01, DIV2 - LFACLKLETIMER0 = LFACLK/2 0x02, DIV4 - LFACLKLETIMER0 = LFACLK/4 0x03, DIV8 - LFACLKLETIMER0 = LFACLK/8 0x04, DIV16 - LFACLKLETIMER0 = LFACLK/16 0x05, DIV32 - LFACLKLETIMER0 = LFACLK/32 0x06, DIV64 - LFACLKLETIMER0 = LFACLK/64 0x07, DIV128 - LFACLKLETIMER0 = LFACLK/128 0x08, DIV256 - LFACLKLETIMER0 = LFACLK/256 0x09, DIV512 - LFACLKLETIMER0 = LFACLK/512 0x0A, DIV1024 - LFACLKLETIMER0 = LFACLK/1024 0x0B, DIV2048 - LFACLKLETIMER0 = LFACLK/2048 0x0C, DIV4096 - LFACLKLETIMER0 = LFACLK/4096 0x0D, DIV8192 - LFACLKLETIMER0 = LFACLK/8192 0x0E, DIV16384 - LFACLKLETIMER0 = LFACLK/16384 0x0F, DIV32768 - LFACLKLETIMER0 = LFACLK/32768

field.name: LESENSE
field.description: Low Energy Sensor Interface Prescaler - Value, Description 0x00, DIV1 - LFACLKLESENSE = LFACLK 0x01, DIV2 - LFACLKLESENSE = LFACLK/2 0x02, DIV4 - LFACLKLESENSE = LFACLK/4 0x03, DIV8 - LFACLKLESENSE = LFACLK/8

register.name: LFBPRESC0
register.description: Low Frequency B Prescaler Register 0 (Async Reg)

field.name: SYSTICK
field.description: Prescaler - Value, Description 0x00, DIV1 - LFBCLKSYSTICK = LFBCLK

field.name: LEUART0
field.description: Low Energy UART 0 Prescaler - Value, Description 0x00, DIV1 - LFBCLKLEUART0 = LFBCLK 0x01, DIV2 - LFBCLKLEUART0 = LFBCLK/2 0x02, DIV4 - LFBCLKLEUART0 = LFBCLK/4 0x03, DIV8 - LFBCLKLEUART0 = LFBCLK/8

field.name: CSEN
field.description: Capacitive touch sense module Prescaler - Value, Description 0x00, DIV16 - LFBCLKCSEN = LFBCLK/16 0x01, DIV32 - LFBCLKCSEN = LFBCLK/32 0x02, DIV64 - LFBCLKCSEN = LFBCLK/64 0x03, DIV128 - LFBCLKCSEN = LFBCLK/128

register.name: LFEPRESC0
register.description: Low Frequency E Prescaler Register 0 (Async Reg). When waking up from EM4 make sure EM4UNLATCH in EMU_CMD is set for this to take effect

field.name: RTCC
field.description: Real-Time Counter and Calendar Prescaler - Value, Description 0x00, DIV1 - LFECLKRTCC = LFECLK 0x01, DIV2 - LFECLKRTCC = LFECLK/2 0x02, DIV4 - LFECLKRTCC = LFECLK/4

field.name: LFACLKEN0
field.description: Low Frequency A Clock Enable 0 Busy

field.description: Low Frequency B Clock Enable 0 Busy

field.name: LFECLKEN0
field.description: Low Frequency E Clock Enable 0 Busy

field.name: ADC0CLKSEL
field.description: ADC0 Clock Select - Value, Description 0x00, DISABLED - ADC0 is not clocked 0x01, AUXHFRCO - AUXHFRCO is clocking ADC0 0x02, HFXO - HFXO is clocking ADC0 0x03, HFSRCCLK - HFSRCCLK is clocking ADC0

field.name: CLKOUT0LOC
field.description: I/O Location - Value, Description 0x00, LOC0 - Location 0 0x01, LOC1 - Location 1 0x02, LOC2 - Location 2 0x03, LOC3 - Location 3 0x04, LOC4 - Location 4 0x05, LOC5 - Location 5 0x06, LOC6 - Location 6 0x07, LOC7 - Location 7

field.name: CLKOUT1LOC

field.name: CLKIN0LOC
field.description: I/O Location - Value, Description 0x00, LOC0 - Location 0 0x01, LOC1 - Location 1 0x02, LOC2 - Location 2 0x03, LOC3 - Location 3 0x04, LOC4 - Location 4

field.name: LOCKKEY
field.description: Configuration Lock Key - Value, Description 0x00, LOCK - 0x00, UNLOCKED - 0x01, LOCKED - 0x0580E, UNLOCK -

field.name: NOBUSYSTALL
field.description: No Stalling of Bus When Busy

field.name: INCWIDTH
field.description: Increment Width - Value, Description 0x00, INCWIDTH1 - Byte 15 in DATA1 is used for the increment function. 0x01, INCWIDTH2 - Bytes 14 and 15 in DATA1 are used for the increment function. 0x02, INCWIDTH3 - Bytes 13 to 15 in DATA1 are used for the increment function. 0x03, INCWIDTH4 - Bytes 12 to 15 in DATA1 are used for the increment function.

field.name: DMA0MODE
field.description: DMA0 Read Mode - Value, Description 0x00, FULL - Target register is fully read/written during every DMA transaction 0x01, LENLIMIT - Length Limited. When the current length, i.e. LENGTHA or LENGTHB indicates that there are less bytes available than the register size, only length + necessary zero padding is read. Zero padding is automatically added when writing. 0x02, FULLBYTE - Target register is fully read/written during every DMA transaction. Bytewise DMA. 0x03, LENLIMITBYTE - Length Limited. When the current length, i.e. LENGTHA or LENGTHB indicates that there are less bytes available than the register size, only length + necessary zero padding is read. Bytewise DMA. Zero padding is automatically added when writing.

field.name: DMA0RSEL
field.description: DMA0 Read Register Select - Value, Description 0x00, DATA0 - 0x01, DDATA0 - 0x02, DDATA0BIG - 0x03, QDATA0 -

field.name: DMA1MODE
field.description: DMA1 Read Mode - Value, Description 0x00, FULL - Target register is fully read/written during every DMA transaction 0x01, LENLIMIT - Length Limited. When the current length, i.e. LENGTHA or LENGTHB indicates that there are less bytes available than the register size, only length + 1 bytes + necessary zero padding is read. Zero padding is automatically added when writing. 0x02, FULLBYTE - Target register is fully read/written during every DMA transaction. Bytewise DMA. 0x03, LENLIMITBYTE - Length Limited. When the current length, i.e. LENGTHA or LENGTHB indicates that there are less bytes available than the register size, only length + 1 bytes + necessary zero padding is read. Bytewise DMA. Zero padding is automatically added when writing.

field.name: DMA1RSEL
field.description: DATA0 DMA Unaligned Read Register Select - Value, Description 0x00, DATA1 - 0x01, DDATA1 - 0x02, QDATA1 - 0x03, QDATA1BIG -

field.name: MODULUS
field.description: Modular Operation Modulus - Value, Description 0x00, BIN256 - Generic modulus. p = 2^256 0x01, BIN128 - Generic modulus. p = 2^128 0x02, ECCBIN233P - Modulus for B-233 and K-233 ECC curves. p(t) = t^233 + t^74 + 1 0x03, ECCBIN163P - Modulus for B-163 and K-163 ECC curves. p(t) = t^163 + t^7 + t^6 + t^3 + 1 0x04, GCMBIN128 - Modulus for GCM. P(t) = t^128 + t^7 + t^2 + t + 1 0x05, ECCPRIME256P - Modulus for P-256 ECC curve. p = 2^256 - 2^224 + 2^192 + 2^96 - 1 0x06, ECCPRIME224P - Modulus for P-224 ECC curve. p = 2^224 - 2^96 - 1 0x07, ECCPRIME192P - Modulus for P-192 ECC curve. p = 2^192 - 2^64 - 1 0x08, ECCBIN233N - P modulus for B-233 ECC curve 0x09, ECCBIN233KN - P modulus for K-233 ECC curve 0x0A, ECCBIN163N - P modulus for B-163 ECC curve 0x0B, ECCBIN163KN - P modulus for K-163 ECC curve 0x0C, ECCPRIME256N - P modulus for P-256 ECC curve 0x0D, ECCPRIME224N - P modulus for P-224 ECC curve 0x0E, ECCPRIME192N - P modulus for P-192 ECC curve

field.name: MULWIDTH
field.description: Multiply Width - Value, Description 0x00, MUL256 - Multiply 256 bits 0x01, MUL128 - Multiply 128 bits 0x02, MULMOD - Same number of bits as specified by MODULUS

field.name: RESULTWIDTH
field.description: Result Width - Value, Description 0x00, 256BIT - Results have 256 bits 0x01, 128BIT - Results have 128 bits 0x02, 260BIT - Results have 260 bits. Upper bits of result can be read through DDATA0MSBS in CRYPTO_STATUS

field.name: INSTR

See detailed instruction listing 0x05, AESENC - AES Encryption 0x06, AESDEC - AES Decryption 0x07, SHA - SHA 0x08, ADD - Add 0x09, ADDC - Add with carry 0x0C, MADD - Modular addition 0x0D, MADD32 - Word-wise addition 0x010, SUB - Subtract 0x011, SUBC - Subtract with carry 0x014, MSUB - Modular subtraction 0x018, MUL - Multiply 0x019, MULC - See detailed instruction listing 0x01C, MMUL - Modular multiplication 0x01D, MULO - See detailed instruction listing 0x020, SHL - Shift left 0x021, SHLC - Shift left with carry (Rotate left) 0x022, SHLB - See detailed instruction listing 0x023, SHL1 - See detailed instruction listing 0x024, SHR - Shift right 0x025, SHRC - Shift right with carry (Rotate right) 0x026, SHRB - field.name: BLOCKSIZE
field.description: Size of data blocks - Value, Description 0x00, 16BYTES - A block is 16 bytes long 0x01, 32BYTES - A block is 32 bytes long 0x02, 64BYTES - A block is 64 bytes long

field.name: NOBUSYSTALL
field.description: No Stalling of Bus When Busy

field.name: INCWIDTH
field.description: Increment Width - Value, Description 0x00, INCWIDTH1 - Byte 15 in DATA1 is used for the increment function. 0x01, INCWIDTH2 - Bytes 14 and 15 in DATA1 are used for the increment function. 0x02, INCWIDTH3 - Bytes 13 to 15 in DATA1 are used for the increment function. 0x03, INCWIDTH4 - Bytes 12 to 15 in DATA1 are used for the increment function.

field.name: DMA0MODE
field.description: DMA0 Read Mode - Value, Description 0x00, FULL - Target register is fully read/written during every DMA transaction 0x01, LENLIMIT - Length Limited. When the current length, i.e. LENGTHA or LENGTHB indicates that there are less bytes available than the register size, only length + necessary zero padding is read. Zero padding is automatically added when writing. 0x02, FULLBYTE - Target register is fully read/written during every DMA transaction. Bytewise DMA. 0x03, LENLIMITBYTE - Length Limited. When the current length, i.e. LENGTHA or LENGTHB indicates that there are less bytes available than the register size, only length + necessary zero padding is read. Bytewise DMA. Zero padding is automatically added when writing.

field.name: DMA0RSEL
field.description: DMA0 Read Register Select - Value, Description 0x00, DATA0 - 0x01, DDATA0 - 0x02, DDATA0BIG - 0x03, QDATA0 -

field.name: DMA1MODE
field.description: DMA1 Read Mode - Value, Description 0x00, FULL - Target register is fully read/written during every DMA transaction 0x01, LENLIMIT - Length Limited. When the current length, i.e. LENGTHA or LENGTHB indicates that there are less bytes available than the register size, only length + 1 bytes + necessary zero padding is read. Zero padding is automatically added when writing. 0x02, FULLBYTE - Target register is fully read/written during every DMA transaction. Bytewise DMA. 0x03, LENLIMITBYTE - Length Limited. When the current length, i.e. LENGTHA or LENGTHB indicates that there are less bytes available than the register size, only length + 1 bytes + necessary zero padding is read. Bytewise DMA. Zero padding is automatically added when writing.

field.name: DMA1RSEL
field.description: DATA0 DMA Unaligned Read Register Select - Value, Description 0x00, DATA1 - 0x01, DDATA1 - 0x02, QDATA1 - 0x03, QDATA1BIG -

field.name: MODULUS
field.description: Modular Operation Modulus - Value, Description 0x00, BIN256 - Generic modulus. p = 2^256 0x01, BIN128 - Generic modulus. p = 2^128 0x02, ECCBIN233P - Modulus for B-233 and K-233 ECC curves. p(t) = t^233 + t^74 + 1 0x03, ECCBIN163P - Modulus for B-163 and K-163 ECC curves. p(t) = t^163 + t^7 + t^6 + t^3 + 1 0x04, GCMBIN128 - Modulus for GCM. P(t) = t^128 + t^7 + t^2 + t + 1 0x05, ECCPRIME256P - Modulus for P-256 ECC curve. p = 2^256 - 2^224 + 2^192 + 2^96 - 1 0x06, ECCPRIME224P - Modulus for P-224 ECC curve. p = 2^224 - 2^96 - 1 0x07, ECCPRIME192P - Modulus for P-192 ECC curve. p = 2^192 - 2^64 - 1 0x08, ECCBIN233N - P modulus for B-233 ECC curve 0x09, ECCBIN233KN - P modulus for K-233 ECC curve 0x0A, ECCBIN163N - P modulus for B-163 ECC curve 0x0B, ECCBIN163KN - P modulus for K-163 ECC curve 0x0C, ECCPRIME256N - P modulus for P-256 ECC curve 0x0D, ECCPRIME224N - P modulus for P-224 ECC curve 0x0E, ECCPRIME192N - P modulus for P-192 ECC curve

field.name: MULWIDTH
field.description: Multiply Width - Value, Description 0x00, MUL256 - Multiply 256 bits 0x01, MUL128 - Multiply 128 bits 0x02, MULMOD - Same number of bits as specified by MODULUS

field.name: RESULTWIDTH
field.description: Result Width - Value, Description 0x00, 256BIT - Results have 256 bits 0x01, 128BIT - Results have 128 bits 0x02, 260BIT - Results have 260 bits. Upper bits of result can be read through DDATA0MSBS in CRYPTO_STATUS

See detailed instruction listing 0x05, AESENC - AES Encryption 0x06, AESDEC - AES Decryption 0x07, SHA - SHA 0x08, ADD - Add 0x09, ADDC - Add with carry 0x0C, MADD - Modular addition 0x0D, MADD32 - Word-wise addition 0x010, SUB - field.name: ARBSLOTS
field.description: Arbitration Slot Number Select - Value, Description 0x00, ONE - One arbitration slot selected 0x01, TWO - Two arbitration slots selected 0x02, FOUR - Four arbitration slots selected 0x03, EIGHT - Eight arbitration slots selected

field.name: STRUCTTYPE
field.description: DMA Structure Type - Value, Description 0x00, TRANSFER - DMA transfer structure type selected. 0x01, SYNCHRONIZE - Synchronization structure type selected. 0x02, WRITE - Write immediate value structure type selected.

field.name: BLOCKSIZE
field.description: Block Transfer Size - Value, Description 0x00, UNIT1 - One unit transfer per arbitration 0x01, UNIT2 - Two unit transfers per arbitration 0x02, UNIT3 - Three unit transfers per arbitration 0x03, UNIT4 - Four unit transfers per arbitration 0x04, UNIT6 - Six unit transfers per arbitration 0x05, UNIT8 - Eight unit transfers per arbitration 0x07, UNIT16 - Sixteen unit transfers per arbitration 0x09, UNIT32 - 32 unit transfers per arbitration 0x0A, UNIT64 - 64 unit transfers per arbitration 0x0B, UNIT128 - 128 unit transfers per arbitration 0x0C, UNIT256 - 256 unit transfers per arbitration 0x0D, UNIT512 - 512 unit transfers per arbitration 0x0E, UNIT1024 - 1024 unit transfers per arbitration 0x0F, ALL - Transfer all units as specified by the XFRCNT field

field.name: DONEIFSEN
field.description: DMA Operation Done Interrupt Flag Set Enable

field.name: SRCINC
field.description: Source Address Increment Size - Value, Description 0x00, ONE - Increment source address by one unit data size after each read 0x01, TWO - Increment source address by two unit data sizes after each read 0x02, FOUR - Increment source address by four unit data sizes after each read 0x03, NONE - Do not increment the source address. In this mode reads are made from a fixed source address, for example reading FIFO.

field.name: SIZE
field.description: Unit Data Transfer Size - Value, Description 0x00, BYTE - Each unit transfer is a byte 0x01, HALFWORD - Each unit transfer is a half-word 0x02, WORD - Each unit transfer is a word

field.name: DSTINC
field.description: Destination Address Increment Size - Value, Description 0x00, ONE - Increment destination address by one unit data size after each write 0x01, TWO - Increment destination address by two unit data sizes after each write 0x02, FOUR - Increment destination address by four unit data sizes after each write 0x03, NONE - Do not increment the destination address. Writes are made to a fixed destination address, for example writing to a FIFO.

field.description: Counter Underflow Output Action - Value, Description 0x00, NONE - No action on counter underflow 0x01, TOGGLE - Toggle output on counter underflow 0x02, CLEAR - Clear output on counter underflow 0x03, SET - Set output on counter underflow

field.name: ICEVCTRL

field.name: ICEDGE
field.description: Input Capture Edge Select - Value, Description 0x00, RISING - Rising edges detected 0x01, FALLING - Falling edges detected 0x02, BOTH - Both edges detected 0x03, NONE - No edge detection, signal is left as it is

field.name: ICEVCTRL
field.description: Input Capture Event Control - Value, Description 0x00, EVERYEDGE - PRS output pulse and interrupt flag set on every capture 0x01, EVERYSECONDEDGE - PRS output pulse and interrupt flag set on every second capture 0x02, RISING - PRS output pulse and interrupt flag set on rising edge only (if ICEDGE = BOTH) 0x03, FALLING - PRS output pulse and interrupt flag set on falling edge only (if ICEDGE = BOTH)

field.name: DTPRSSEL
field.description: DTI PRS Source Channel Select - Value, Description 0x00, PRSCH0 - PRS Channel 0 selected as input 0x01, PRSCH1 - PRS Channel 1 selected as input 0x02, PRSCH2 - PRS Channel 2 selected as input 0x03, PRSCH3 - PRS Channel 3 selected as input 0x04, PRSCH4 - PRS Channel 4 selected as input 0x05, PRSCH5 - PRS Channel 5 selected as input 0x06, PRSCH6 - PRS Channel 6 selected as input 0x07, PRSCH7 - PRS Channel 7 selected as input 0x08, PRSCH8 - PRS Channel 8 selected as input 0x09, PRSCH9 - PRS Channel 9 selected as input 0x0A, PRSCH10 - PRS Channel 10 selected as input 0x0B, PRSCH11 - PRS Channel 11 selected as input

field.name: DTFATS
field.description: DTI Fault Action on Timer Stop

field.name: DTPRESC
field.description: DTI Prescaler Setting - Value, Description 0x00, DIV1 - The HFPERCLK is undivided 0x01, DIV2 - The HFPERCLK is divided by 2 0x02, DIV4 - The HFPERCLK is divided by 4 0x03, DIV8 - The HFPERCLK is divided by 8 0x04, DIV16 - The HFPERCLK is divided by 16 0x05, DIV32 - The HFPERCLK is divided by 32 0x06, DIV64 - The HFPERCLK is divided by 64 0x07, DIV128 - The HFPERCLK is divided by 128 0x08, DIV256 - The HFPERCLK is divided by 256 0x09, DIV512 - The HFPERCLK is divided by 512 0x0A, DIV1024 - The HFPERCLK is divided by 1024

field.name: DTPRS0FSEL
field.description: DTI PRS Fault Source 0 Select - Value, Description 0x00, PRSCH0 - PRS Channel 0 selected as fault source 0 0x01, PRSCH1 - PRS Channel 1 selected as fault source 1 0x02, PRSCH2 - PRS Channel 2 selected as fault source 2 0x03, PRSCH3 - PRS Channel 3 selected as fault source 3 0x04, PRSCH4 - PRS Channel 4 selected as fault source 4 0x05, PRSCH5 - PRS Channel 5 selected as fault source 5 0x06, PRSCH6 - PRS Channel 6 selected as fault source 6 0x07, PRSCH7 - PRS Channel 7 selected as fault source 7 0x08, PRSCH8 - PRS Channel 8 selected as fault source 8 0x09, PRSCH9 - PRS Channel 9 selected as fault source 9 0x0A, PRSCH10 - PRS Channel 10 selected as fault source 10 0x0B, PRSCH11 - PRS Channel 11 selected as fault source 11

field.name: DTPRS1FSEL
field.description: DTI PRS Fault Source 1 Select - Value, Description 0x00, PRSCH0 - PRS Channel 0 selected as fault source 1 0x01, PRSCH1 - PRS Channel 1 selected as fault source 1 0x02, PRSCH2 - PRS Channel 2 selected as fault source 1 0x03, PRSCH3 - PRS Channel 3 selected as fault source 1 0x04, PRSCH4 - PRS Channel 4 selected as fault source 1 0x05, PRSCH5 - PRS Channel 5 selected as fault source 1 0x06, PRSCH6 - PRS Channel 6 selected as fault source 1 0x07, PRSCH7 - PRS Channel 7 selected as fault source 1 0x08, PRSCH8 - PRS Channel 8 selected as fault source 1 0x09, PRSCH9 - PRS Channel 9 selected as fault source 1 0x0A, PRSCH10 - PRS Channel 10 selected as fault source 1 0x0B, PRSCH11 - PRS Channel 11 selected as fault source 1

field.name: DTFA
field.description: DTI Fault Action - Value, Description 0x00, NONE - No action on fault 0x01, INACTIVE - Set outputs inactive 0x02, CLEAR - Clear outputs 0x03, TRISTATE - Tristate outputs

field.name: LOCKKEY
field.description: DTI Lock Key - Value, Description 0x00, LOCK - 0x00, UNLOCKED - 0x01, LOCKED - 0x0CE80, UNLOCK -

field.name: OVS
field.description: Oversampling - Value, Description 0x00, X16 - Regular UART mode with 16X oversampling in asynchronous mode 0x01, X8 - Double speed with 8X oversampling in asynchronous mode 0x02, X6 - 6X oversampling in asynchronous mode 0x03, X4 - Quadruple speed with 4X oversampling in asynchronous mode

field.name: CSMA
field.description: Action On Slave-Select In Master Mode

field.name: AUTOTX
field.description: Always Transmit When RX Not Full

field.name: DATABITS
field.description: Data-Bit Mode - Value, Description 0x01, FOUR - Each frame contains 4 data bits 0x02, FIVE - Each frame contains 5 data bits 0x03, SIX - Each frame contains 6 data bits 0x04, SEVEN - Each frame contains 7 data bits 0x05, EIGHT - Each frame contains 8 data bits 0x06, NINE - Each frame contains 9 data bits 0x07, TEN - Each frame contains 10 data bits 0x08, ELEVEN - Each frame contains 11 data bits 0x09, TWELVE - Each frame contains 12 data bits 0x0A, THIRTEEN - Each frame contains 13 data bits 0x0B, FOURTEEN - Each frame contains 14 data bits 0x0C, FIFTEEN - Each frame contains 15 data bits 0x0D, SIXTEEN - Each frame contains 16 data bits

field.name: PARITY
field.description: Parity-Bit Mode - Value, Description 0x00, NONE - Parity bits are not used 0x02, EVEN - Even parity are used. Parity bits are automatically generated and checked by hardware. 0x03, ODD - Odd parity is used. Parity bits are automatically generated and checked by hardware.

field.name: STOPBITS
field.description: Stop-Bit Mode - Value, Description 0x00, HALF - The transmitter generates a half stop bit. Stop-bits are not verified by receiver 0x01, ONE - One stop bit is generated and verified 0x02, ONEANDAHALF - The transmitter generates one and a half stop bit. The receiver verifies the first stop bit 0x03, TWO - The transmitter generates two stop bits. The receiver checks the first stop-bit only

field.name: TXARX0EN
field.description: Enable Transmit Trigger after RX End of Frame plus TCMP0VAL

field.name: TXARX1EN
field.description: Enable Transmit Trigger after RX End of Frame plus TCMP1VAL

field.name: TXARX2EN
field.description: Enable Transmit Trigger after RX End of Frame plus TCMP2VAL

field.name: RXATX0EN
field.description: Enable Receive Trigger after TX end of frame plus TCMPVAL0 baud-times

field.name: RXATX1EN
field.description: Enable Receive Trigger after TX end of frame plus TCMPVAL1 baud-times

field.name: RXATX2EN
field.description: Enable Receive Trigger after TX end of frame plus TCMPVAL2 baud-times

field.name: TSEL
field.description: Trigger PRS Channel Select - Value, Description 0x00, PRSCH0 - PRS Channel 0 selected 0x01, PRSCH1 - PRS Channel 1 selected 0x02, PRSCH2 - PRS Channel 2 selected 0x03, PRSCH3 - PRS Channel 3 selected 0x04, PRSCH4 - PRS Channel 4 selected 0x05, PRSCH5 - PRS Channel 5 selected 0x06, PRSCH6 - PRS Channel 6 selected 0x07, PRSCH7 - PRS Channel 7 selected 0x08, PRSCH8 - PRS Channel 8 selected 0x09, PRSCH9 - PRS Channel 9 selected 0x0A, PRSCH10 - PRS Channel 10 selected 0x0B, PRSCH11 - PRS Channel 11 selected

field.name: TXBDRIGHT
field.description: TX Buffer Expects Double Right Data

field.name: TXBSRIGHT
field.description: TX Buffer Expects Single Right Data

register.description: RX Buffer Double Data Extended Register

register.name: RXDATAXP
register.description: RX Buffer Data Extended Peek Register

register.name: RXDOUBLEXP
register.description: RX Buffer Double Data Extended Peek Register

register.name: TXDOUBLEX
register.description: TX Buffer Double Data Extended Register

field.name: SSM
field.description: Slave-Select In Master Mode Interrupt Flag

field.name: IRPW
field.description: IrDA TX Pulse Width - Value, Description 0x00, ONE - IrDA pulse width is 1/16 for OVS=0 and 1/8 for OVS=1 0x01, TWO - IrDA pulse width is 2/16 for OVS=0 and 2/8 for OVS=1 0x02, THREE - IrDA pulse width is 3/16 for OVS=0 and 3/8 for OVS=1 0x03, FOUR - IrDA pulse width is 4/16 for OVS=0 and 4/8 for OVS=1

field.name: IRPRSSEL
field.description: IrDA PRS Channel Select - Value, Description 0x00, PRSCH0 - PRS Channel 0 selected 0x01, PRSCH1 - PRS Channel 1 selected 0x02, PRSCH2 - PRS Channel 2 selected 0x03, PRSCH3 - PRS Channel 3 selected 0x04, PRSCH4 - PRS Channel 4 selected 0x05, PRSCH5 - PRS Channel 5 selected 0x06, PRSCH6 - PRS Channel 6 selected 0x07, PRSCH7 - PRS Channel 7 selected 0x08, PRSCH8 - PRS Channel 8 selected 0x09, PRSCH9 - PRS Channel 9 selected 0x0A, PRSCH10 - PRS Channel 10 selected 0x0B, PRSCH11 - PRS Channel 11 selected

field.name: RXPRSSEL
field.description: RX PRS Channel Select - Value, Description 0x00, PRSCH0 - PRS Channel 0 selected 0x01, PRSCH1 - PRS Channel 1 selected 0x02, PRSCH2 - PRS Channel 2 selected 0x03, PRSCH3 - PRS Channel 3 selected 0x04, PRSCH4 - PRS Channel 4 selected 0x05, PRSCH5 - PRS Channel 5 selected 0x06, PRSCH6 - PRS Channel 6 selected 0x07, PRSCH7 - PRS Channel 7 selected 0x08, PRSCH8 - PRS Channel 8 selected 0x09, PRSCH9 - PRS Channel 9 selected 0x0A, PRSCH10 - PRS Channel 10 selected 0x0B, PRSCH11 - PRS Channel 11 selected

field.name: CLKPRSSEL
field.description: CLK PRS Channel Select - Value, Description 0x00, PRSCH0 - PRS Channel 0 selected 0x01, PRSCH1 - PRS Channel 1 selected 0x02, PRSCH2 - PRS Channel 2 selected 0x03, PRSCH3 - PRS Channel 3 selected 0x04, PRSCH4 - PRS Channel 4 selected 0x05, PRSCH5 - PRS Channel 5 selected 0x06, PRSCH6 - PRS Channel 6 selected 0x07, PRSCH7 - PRS Channel 7 selected 0x08, PRSCH8 - PRS Channel 8 selected 0x09, PRSCH9 - PRS Channel 9 selected 0x0A, PRSCH10 - PRS Channel 10 selected 0x0B, PRSCH11 - PRS Channel 11 selected

field.name: DMASPLIT
field.description: Separate DMA Request For Left/Right Data

field.name: FORMAT
field.description: I2S Word Format - Value, Description 0x00, W32D32 - 32-bit word, 32-bit data 0x01, W32D24M - 32-bit word, 32-bit data with 8 lsb masked 0x02, W32D24 - 32-bit word, 24-bit data 0x03, W32D16 - 32-bit word, 16-bit data 0x04, W32D8 - 32-bit word, 8-bit data 0x05, W16D16 - 16-bit word, 16-bit data 0x06, W16D8 - 16-bit word, 8-bit data 0x07, W8D8 - 8-bit word, 8-bit data

field.name: TXDELAY
field.description: TX frame start delay - Value, Description 0x00, DISABLE - Disable - TXDELAY in USARTn_CTRL can be used for legacy 0x01, ONE - Start of transmission is delayed for 1 baud-times 0x02, TWO - Start of transmission is delayed for 2 baud-times 0x03, THREE - Start of transmission is delayed for 3 baud-times 0x04, SEVEN - Start of transmission is delayed for 7 baud-times 0x05, TCMP0 - Start of transmission is delayed for TCMPVAL0 baud-times 0x06, TCMP1 - Start of transmission is delayed for TCMPVAL1 baud-times 0x07, TCMP2 - Start of transmission is delayed for TCMPVAL2 baud-times

field.name: CSSETUP
field.description: Chip Select Setup - Value, Description 0x00, ZERO - CS is not asserted before start of transmission 0x01, ONE - CS is asserted for 1 baud-times before start of transmission 0x02, TWO - CS is asserted for 2 baud-times before start of transmission 0x03, THREE - CS is asserted for 3 baud-times before start of transmission 0x04, SEVEN - CS is asserted for 7 baud-times before start of transmission 0x05, TCMP0 - CS is asserted before the start of transmission for TCMPVAL0 baud-times 0x06, TCMP1 - CS is asserted before the start of transmission for TCMPVAL1 baud-times 0x07, TCMP2 - CS is asserted before the start of transmission for TCMPVAL2 baud-times

field.name: ICS
field.description: Inter-character spacing - Value, Description 0x00, ZERO - There is no space between charcters 0x01, ONE - Create a space of 1 baud-times before start of transmission 0x02, TWO - Create a space of 2 baud-times before start of transmission 0x03, THREE - Create a space of 3 baud-times before start of transmission 0x04, SEVEN - Create a space of 7 baud-times before start of transmission 0x05, TCMP0 - Create a space of before the start of transmission for TCMPVAL0 baud-times 0x06, TCMP1 - Create a space of before the start of transmission for TCMPVAL1 baud-times 0x07, TCMP2 - Create a space of before the start of transmission for TCMPVAL2 baud-times

field.name: CSHOLD
field.description: Chip Select Hold - Value, Description 0x00, ZERO - Disable CS being asserted after the end of transmission 0x01, ONE - CS is asserted for 1 baud-times after the end of transmission 0x02, TWO - CS is asserted for 2 baud-times after the end of transmission 0x03, THREE - CS is asserted for 3 baud-times after the end of transmission 0x04, SEVEN - CS is asserted for 7 baud-times after the end of transmission 0x05, TCMP0 - CS is asserted after the end of transmission for TCMPVAL0 baud-times 0x06, TCMP1 - CS is asserted after the end of transmission for TCMPVAL1 baud-times 0x07, TCMP2 - CS is asserted after the end of transmission for TCMPVAL2 baud-times

register.name: TIMECMP0
register.description: Used to generate interrupts and various delays

field.name: TSTART
field.description: Timer start source - Value, Description 0x00, DISABLE - Comparator 0 is disabled 0x01, TXEOF - Comparator 0 and timer are started at TX end of frame 0x02, TXC - Comparator 0 and timer are started at TX Complete 0x03, RXACT - Comparator 0 and timer are started at RX going Active (default: low) 0x04, RXEOF - Comparator 0 and timer are started at RX end of frame

field.name: TSTOP
field.description: Source used to disable comparator 0 - Value, Description 0x00, TCMP0 - Comparator 0 is disabled when the counter equals TCMPVAL and triggers a TCMP0 event 0x01, TXST - Comparator 0 is disabled at the start of transmission 0x02, RXACT - Comparator 0 is disabled on RX going going Active (default: low) 0x03, RXACTN - Comparator 0 is disabled on RX going Inactive

register.name: TIMECMP1
register.description: Used to generate interrupts and various delays

field.name: TSTART
field.description: Timer start source - Value, Description 0x00, DISABLE - Comparator 1 is disabled 0x01, TXEOF - Comparator 1 and timer are started at TX end of frame 0x02, TXC - Comparator 1 and timer are started at TX Complete 0x03, RXACT - Comparator 1 and timer are started at RX going going Active (default: low) 0x04, RXEOF - Comparator 1 and timer are started at RX end of frame

field.name: TSTOP
field.description: Source used to disable comparator 1 - Value, Description 0x00, TCMP1 - Comparator 1 is disabled when the counter equals TCMPVAL and triggers a TCMP1 event 0x01, TXST - Comparator 1 is disabled at TX start TX Engine 0x02, RXACT - Comparator 1 is disabled on RX going going Active (default: low) 0x03, RXACTN - Comparator 1 is disabled on RX going Inactive

register.name: TIMECMP2
register.description: Used to generate interrupts and various delays

field.name: TSTART
field.description: Timer start source - Value, Description 0x00, DISABLE - Comparator 2 is disabled 0x01, TXEOF - Comparator 2 and timer are started at TX end of frame 0x02, TXC - Comparator 2 and timer are started at TX Complete 0x03, RXACT - Comparator 2 and timer are started at RX going going Active (default: low) 0x04, RXEOF - Comparator 2 and timer are started at RX end of frame

field.name: TSTOP
field.description: Source used to disable comparator 2 - Value, Description 0x00, TCMP2 - Comparator 2 is disabled when the counter equals TCMPVAL and triggers a TCMP2 event 0x01, TXST - Comparator 2 is disabled at TX start TX Engine 0x02, RXACT - Comparator 2 is disabled on RX going going Active (default: low) 0x03, RXACTN - Comparator 2 is disabled on RX going Inactive

field.name: DATABITS

field.name: PARITY
field.description: Parity-Bit Mode - Value, Description 0x00, NONE - Parity bits are not used 0x02, EVEN - Even parity are used. Parity bits are automatically generated and checked by hardware. 0x03, ODD - Odd parity is used. Parity bits are automatically generated and checked by hardware.

field.name: STOPBITS
field.description: Stop-Bit Mode - Value, Description 0x00, HALF - The transmitter generates a half stop bit. Stop-bits are not verified by receiver 0x01, ONE - One stop bit is generated and verified 0x02, ONEANDAHALF - The transmitter generates one and a half stop bit. The receiver verifies the first stop bit 0x03, TWO - The transmitter generates two stop bits. The receiver checks the first stop-bit only

field.name: PARITY
field.description: Parity-Bit Mode - Value, Description 0x00, NONE - Parity bits are not used 0x02, EVEN - Even parity are used. Parity bits are automatically generated and checked by hardware. 0x03, ODD - Odd parity is used. Parity bits are automatically generated and checked by hardware.

field.name: TXDELAY
field.description: TX Delay Transmission - Value, Description 0x00, NONE - Frames are transmitted immediately 0x01, SINGLE - Transmission of new frames are delayed by a single bit period 0x02, DOUBLE - Transmission of new frames are delayed by two bit periods 0x03, TRIPLE - Transmission of new frames are delayed by three bit periods

field.description: RX PRS Channel Select - Value, Description 0x00, PRSCH0 - PRS Channel 0 selected 0x01, PRSCH1 - PRS Channel 1 selected 0x02, PRSCH2 - PRS Channel 2 selected 0x03, PRSCH3 - PRS Channel 3 selected 0x04, PRSCH4 - PRS Channel 4 selected 0x05, PRSCH5 - PRS Channel 5 selected 0x06, PRSCH6 - PRS Channel 6 selected 0x07, PRSCH7 - PRS Channel 7 selected 0x08, PRSCH8 - PRS Channel 8 selected 0x09, PRSCH9 - PRS Channel 9 selected 0x0A, PRSCH10 - PRS Channel 10 selected 0x0B, PRSCH11 - PRS Channel 11 selected

field.name: REPMODE
field.description: Repeat Mode - Value, Description 0x00, FREE - When started, the LETIMER counts down until it is stopped by software 0x01, ONESHOT - The counter counts REP0 times. When REP0 reaches zero, the counter stops 0x02, BUFFERED - The counter counts REP0 times. If REP1 has been written, it is loaded into REP0 when REP0 reaches zero, otherwise the counter stops 0x03, DOUBLE - Both REP0 and REP1 are decremented when the LETIMER wraps around. The LETIMER counts until both REP0 and REP1 are zero

field.name: UFOA0
field.description: Underflow Output Action 0 - Value, Description 0x00, NONE - LETn_O0 is held at its idle value as defined by OPOL0 0x01, TOGGLE - LETn_O0 is toggled on CNT underflow 0x02, PULSE - LETn_O0 is held active for one LFACLKLETIMER0 clock cycle on CNT underflow. The output then returns to its idle value as defined by OPOL0 0x03, PWM - LETn_O0 is set idle on CNT underflow, and active on compare match with COMP1

field.name: UFOA1
field.description: Underflow Output Action 1 - Value, Description 0x00, NONE - LETn_O1 is held at its idle value as defined by OPOL1 0x01, TOGGLE - LETn_O1 is toggled on CNT underflow 0x02, PULSE - LETn_O1 is held active for one LFACLKLETIMER0 clock cycle on CNT underflow. The output then returns to its idle value as defined by OPOL1 0x03, PWM - LETn_O1 is set idle on CNT underflow, and active on compare match with COMP1

field.description: I/O Location - Value, Description 0x00, LOC0 - Location 0 0x01, LOC1 - Location 1 0x02, LOC2 - Location 2 0x03, LOC3 - Location 3 0x04, LOC4 - Location 4 0x05, LOC5 - Location 5 0x06, LOC6 - Location 6 0x07, LOC7 - Location 7 0x08, LOC8 - Location 8 0x09, LOC9 - Location 9 0x0A, LOC10 - Location 10 0x0B, LOC11 - Location 11 0x0C, LOC12 - Location 12 0x0D, LOC13 - Location 13 0x0E, LOC14 - Location 14 0x0F, LOC15 - Location 15 0x010, LOC16 - Location 16 0x011, LOC17 - Location 17 0x012, LOC18 - Location 18 0x013, LOC19 - Location 19 0x014, LOC20 - Location 20 0x015, LOC21 - Location 21 0x016, LOC22 - Location 22 0x017, LOC23 - Location 23 0x018, LOC24 - Location 24 0x019, LOC25 - Location 25 0x01A, LOC26 - Location 26 0x01B, LOC27 - Location 27 0x01C, LOC28 - Location 28 0x01D, LOC29 - Location 29 0x01E, LOC30 - Location 30 0x01F, LOC31 - Location 31

field.name: PRSSTARTSEL
field.description: PRS Start Select - Value, Description 0x00, PRSCH0 - PRS Channel 0 selected as input 0x01, PRSCH1 - PRS Channel 1 selected as input 0x02, PRSCH2 - PRS Channel 2 selected as input 0x03, PRSCH3 - PRS Channel 3 selected as input 0x04, PRSCH4 - PRS Channel 4 selected as input 0x05, PRSCH5 - PRS Channel 5 selected as input 0x06, PRSCH6 - PRS Channel 6 selected as input 0x07, PRSCH7 - PRS Channel 7 selected as input 0x08, PRSCH8 - PRS Channel 8 selected as input 0x09, PRSCH9 - PRS Channel 9 selected as input 0x0A, PRSCH10 - PRS Channel 10 selected as input 0x0B, PRSCH11 - PRS Channel 11 selected as input

field.name: PRSSTOPSEL
field.description: PRS Stop Select - Value, Description 0x00, PRSCH0 - PRS Channel 0 selected as input 0x01, PRSCH1 - PRS Channel 1 selected as input 0x02, PRSCH2 - PRS Channel 2 selected as input 0x03, PRSCH3 - PRS Channel 3 selected as input 0x04, PRSCH4 - PRS Channel 4 selected as input 0x05, PRSCH5 - PRS Channel 5 selected as input 0x06, PRSCH6 - PRS Channel 6 selected as input 0x07, PRSCH7 - PRS Channel 7 selected as input 0x08, PRSCH8 - PRS Channel 8 selected as input 0x09, PRSCH9 - PRS Channel 9 selected as input 0x0A, PRSCH10 - PRS Channel 10 selected as input 0x0B, PRSCH11 - PRS Channel 11 selected as input

field.name: PRSCLEARSEL
field.description: PRS Clear Select - Value, Description 0x00, PRSCH0 - PRS Channel 0 selected as input 0x01, PRSCH1 - PRS Channel 1 selected as input 0x02, PRSCH2 - PRS Channel 2 selected as input 0x03, PRSCH3 - PRS Channel 3 selected as input 0x04, PRSCH4 - PRS Channel 4 selected as input 0x05, PRSCH5 - PRS Channel 5 selected as input 0x06, PRSCH6 - PRS Channel 6 selected as input 0x07, PRSCH7 - PRS Channel 7 selected as input 0x08, PRSCH8 - PRS Channel 8 selected as input 0x09, PRSCH9 - PRS Channel 9 selected as input 0x0A, PRSCH10 - PRS Channel 10 selected as input 0x0B, PRSCH11 - PRS Channel 11 selected as input

field.name: PRSSTARTMODE
field.description: PRS Start Mode - Value, Description 0x00, NONE - PRS cannot start the LETIMER 0x01, RISING - Rising edge of selected PRS input can start the LETIMER 0x02, FALLING - Falling edge of selected PRS input can start the LETIMER 0x03, BOTH - Both the rising or falling edge of the selected PRS input can start the LETIMER

field.name: PRSSTOPMODE
field.description: PRS Stop Mode - Value, Description 0x00, NONE - PRS cannot stop the LETIMER 0x01, RISING - Rising edge of selected PRS input can stop the LETIMER 0x02, FALLING - Falling edge of selected PRS input can stop the LETIMER 0x03, BOTH - Both the rising or falling edge of the selected PRS input can stop the LETIMER

field.name: PRSCLEARMODE
field.description: PRS Clear Mode - Value, Description 0x00, NONE - PRS cannot clear the LETIMER 0x01, RISING - Rising edge of selected PRS input can clear the LETIMER 0x02, FALLING - Falling edge of selected PRS input can clear the LETIMER 0x03, BOTH - Both the rising or falling edge of the selected PRS input can clear the LETIMER

field.name: OSCSEL
field.description: Select Low frequency oscillator - Value, Description 0x00, DISABLED - Output is driven low 0x01, LFRCO - Select Low Frequency RC Oscillator 0x02, LFXO - Select Low Frequency Crystal Oscillator 0x03, ULFRCO - Select Ultra Low Frequency RC Oscillator

field.name: PRESC
field.description: Prescaler Setting - Value, Description 0x00, DIV1 - LF Oscillator frequency undivided 0x01, DIV2 - LF Oscillator frequency divided by 2 0x02, DIV4 - LF Oscillator frequency divided by 4 0x03, DIV8 - LF Oscillator frequency divided by 8 0x04, DIV16 - LF Oscillator frequency divided by 16 0x05, DIV32 - LF Oscillator frequency divided by 32 0x06, DIV64 - LF Oscillator frequency divided by 64 0x07, DIV128 - LF Oscillator frequency divided by 128

field.name: MODE
field.description: Mode Select - Value, Description 0x00, DISABLE - The module is disabled. 0x01, OVSSINGLE - Single input LFACLK oversampling mode (available in EM0-EM3). 0x02, EXTCLKSINGLE - Externally clocked single input counter mode (available in EM0-EM3). 0x03, EXTCLKQUAD - Externally clocked quadrature decoder mode (available in EM0-EM3). 0x04, OVSQUAD1X - LFACLK oversampling quadrature decoder 1X mode (available in EM0-EM3). 0x05, OVSQUAD2X - LFACLK oversampling quadrature decoder 2X mode (available in EM0-EM3). 0x06, OVSQUAD4X - LFACLK oversampling quadrature decoder 4X mode (available in EM0-EM3).

field.name: CNTEV
field.description: Controls when the counter counts - Value, Description 0x00, BOTH - Counts up on up-count and down on down-count events. 0x01, UP - Only counts up on up-count events. 0x02, DOWN - Only counts down on down-count events. 0x03, NONE - Never counts.

field.name: AUXCNTEV
field.description: Controls when the auxiliary counter counts - Value, Description 0x00, NONE - Never counts. 0x01, UP - Counts up on up-count events. 0x02, DOWN - Counts up on down-count events. 0x03, BOTH - Counts up on both up-count and down-count events.

field.name: TCCMODE
field.description: Sets the mode for triggered compare and clear - Value, Description 0x00, DISABLED - Triggered compare and clear not enabled. 0x01, LFA - Compare and clear performed on each (optionally prescaled) LFA clock cycle. 0x02, PRS - Compare and clear performed on positive PRS edges.

field.name: TCCPRESC
field.description: Set the LFA prescaler for triggered compare and clear - Value, Description 0x00, DIV1 - Compare and clear event each LFA cycle. 0x01, DIV2 - Compare and clear performed on every other LFA cycle. 0x02, DIV4 - Compare and clear performed on every 4th LFA cycle. 0x03, DIV8 - Compare and clear performed on every 8th LFA cycle.

field.name: TCCCOMP
field.description: Triggered compare and clear compare mode - Value, Description 0x00, LTOE - Compare match if PCNT_CNT is less than, or equal to PCNT_TOP. 0x01, GTOE - Compare match if PCNT_CNT is greater than or equal to PCNT_TOP. 0x02, RANGE - Compare match if PCNT_CNT is less than, or equal to PCNT_TOP[15:8]], and greater than, or equal to PCNT_TOP[7:0].

field.name: TCCPRSSEL
field.description: TCC PRS Channel Select - Value, Description 0x00, PRSCH0 - PRS Channel 0 selected. 0x01, PRSCH1 - PRS Channel 1 selected. 0x02, PRSCH2 - PRS Channel 2 selected. 0x03, PRSCH3 - PRS Channel 3 selected. 0x04, PRSCH4 - PRS Channel 4 selected. 0x05, PRSCH5 - PRS Channel 5 selected. 0x06, PRSCH6 - PRS Channel 6 selected. 0x07, PRSCH7 - PRS Channel 7 selected. 0x08, PRSCH8 - PRS Channel 8 selected. 0x09, PRSCH9 - PRS Channel 9 selected. 0x0A, PRSCH10 - PRS Channel 10 selected. 0x0B, PRSCH11 - PRS Channel 11 selected.

field.name: FILTLEN
field.description: Configure filter length for inputs S0IN and S1IN

field.name: CLHR
field.description: Clock Low High Ratio - Value, Description 0x00, STANDARD - The ratio between low period and high period counters (Nlow:Nhigh) is 4:4 0x01, ASYMMETRIC - The ratio between low period and high period counters (Nlow:Nhigh) is 6:3 0x02, FAST - The ratio between low period and high period counters (Nlow:Nhigh) is 11:6

field.name: BITO
field.description: Bus Idle Timeout - Value, Description 0x00, OFF - Timeout disabled 0x01, 40PCC - Timeout after 40 prescaled clock cycles. In standard mode at 100 kHz, this results in a 50us timeout. 0x02, 80PCC - Timeout after 80 prescaled clock cycles. In standard mode at 100 kHz, this results in a 100us timeout. 0x03, 160PCC - Timeout after 160 prescaled clock cycles. In standard mode at 100 kHz, this results in a 200us timeout.

field.name: GIBITO
field.description: Go Idle on Bus Idle Timeout

field.name: CLTO
field.description: Clock Low Timeout - Value, Description 0x00, OFF - Timeout disabled 0x01, 40PCC - Timeout after 40 prescaled clock cycles. In standard mode at 100 kHz, this results in a 50us timeout. 0x02, 80PCC - Timeout after 80 prescaled clock cycles. In standard mode at 100 kHz, this results in a 100us timeout. 0x03, 160PCC - Timeout after 160 prescaled clock cycles. In standard mode at 100 kHz, this results in a 200us timeout. 0x04, 320PCC - Timeout after 320 prescaled clock cycles. In standard mode at 100 kHz, this results in a 400us timeout. 0x05, 1024PCC - Timeout after 1024 prescaled clock cycles. In standard mode at 100 kHz, this results in a 1280us timeout.

field.name: STATE
field.description: Transmission State - Value, Description 0x00, IDLE - No transmission is being performed. 0x01, WAIT - Waiting for idle. Will send a start condition as soon as the bus is idle. 0x02, START - Start transmitted or received 0x03, ADDR - Address transmitted or received 0x04, ADDRACK - Address ack/nack transmitted or received 0x05, DATA - Data transmitted or received 0x06, DATAACK - Data ack/nack transmitted or received

field.name: CLHR
field.description: Clock Low High Ratio - Value, Description 0x00, STANDARD - The ratio between low period and high period counters (Nlow:Nhigh) is 4:4 0x01, ASYMMETRIC - The ratio between low period and high period counters (Nlow:Nhigh) is 6:3 0x02, FAST - The ratio between low period and high period counters (Nlow:Nhigh) is 11:6

field.name: BITO
field.description: Bus Idle Timeout - Value, Description 0x00, OFF - Timeout disabled 0x01, 40PCC - Timeout after 40 prescaled clock cycles. In standard mode at 100 kHz, this results in a 50us timeout. 0x02, 80PCC - Timeout after 80 prescaled clock cycles. In standard mode at 100 kHz, this results in a 100us timeout. 0x03, 160PCC - Timeout after 160 prescaled clock cycles. In standard mode at 100 kHz, this results in a 200us timeout.

field.name: GIBITO
field.description: Go Idle on Bus Idle Timeout

field.name: CLTO
field.description: Clock Low Timeout - Value, Description 0x00, OFF - Timeout disabled 0x01, 40PCC - Timeout after 40 prescaled clock cycles. In standard mode at 100 kHz, this results in a 50us timeout. 0x02, 80PCC - Timeout after 80 prescaled clock cycles. In standard mode at 100 kHz, this results in a 100us timeout. 0x03, 160PCC - Timeout after 160 prescaled clock cycles. In standard mode at 100 kHz, this results in a 200us timeout. 0x04, 320PCC - Timeout after 320 prescaled clock cycles. In standard mode at 100 kHz, this results in a 400us timeout. 0x05, 1024PCC - Timeout after 1024 prescaled clock cycles. In standard mode at 100 kHz, this results in a 1280us timeout.

field.name: STATE
field.description: Transmission State - Value, Description 0x00, IDLE - No transmission is being performed. 0x01, WAIT - Waiting for idle. Will send a start condition as soon as the bus is idle. 0x02, START - Start transmitted or received 0x03, ADDR - Address transmitted or received 0x04, ADDRACK - Address ack/nack transmitted or received 0x05, DATA - Data transmitted or received 0x06, DATAACK - Data ack/nack transmitted or received

register.name: RXDOUBLEP
register.description: Receive Buffer Double Data Peek Register

field.name: WARMUPMODE
field.description: Warm-up Mode - Value, Description 0x00, NORMAL - ADC is shut down after each conversion. 5us warmup time is used before each conversion. 0x01, KEEPINSTANDBY - ADC is kept in standby mode between conversions. 1us warmup time is used before each conversion. 0x02, KEEPINSLOWACC - ADC is kept in slow acquisition mode between conversions. 1us warmup time is used before each conversion. 0x03, KEEPADCWARM - ADC is kept on after conversions, allowing for continuous conversion.

field.name: ASYNCCLKEN
field.description: Selects ASYNC CLK enable mode when ADCCLKMODE=1

field.name: PRESC
field.description: Prescalar Setting for ADC Sample and Conversion clock - Value, Description 0x00, NODIVISION -

field.name: OVSRSEL
field.description: Oversample Rate Select - Value, Description 0x00, X2 - 2 samples for each conversion result 0x01, X4 - 4 samples for each conversion result 0x02, X8 - 8 samples for each conversion result 0x03, X16 - 16 samples for each conversion result 0x04, X32 - 32 samples for each conversion result 0x05, X64 - 64 samples for each conversion result 0x06, X128 - 128 samples for each conversion result 0x07, X256 - 256 samples for each conversion result 0x08, X512 - 512 samples for each conversion result 0x09, X1024 - 1024 samples for each conversion result 0x0A, X2048 - 2048 samples for each conversion result 0x0B, X4096 - 4096 samples for each conversion result

field.name: CHCONREFWARMIDLE
field.description: Channel Connect and Reference Warm Sel when ADC is IDLE - Value, Description 0x00, PREFSCAN - Keep scan reference warm and APORT switches for first scan channel closed if WARMUPMODE is not NORMAL 0x01, PREFSINGLE - Keep single reference warm and keep APORT switches for single channel closed if WARMUPMODE is not NORMAL 0x02, KEEPPREV - Keep last used reference warm and keep APORT switches for corresponding channel closed if WARMUPMODE is not NORMAL

field.name: PROGERR
field.description: Programming Error Status - Value, Description 0x01, BUSCONF - 0x02, NEGSELCONF -

field.name: RES
field.description: Single Channel Resolution Select - Value, Description 0x00, 12BIT - 12-bit resolution. 0x01, 8BIT - 8-bit resolution. 0x02, 6BIT - 6-bit resolution. 0x03, OVS - Oversampling enabled. Oversampling rate is set in OVSRSEL.

field.name: REF
field.description: Single Channel Reference Selection - Value, Description 0x00, 1V25 - VFS = 1.25V with internal VBGR reference 0x01, 2V5 - VFS = 2.5V with internal VBGR reference 0x02, VDD - VFS = AVDD with AVDD as reference source 0x03, 5V - VFS = 5V with internal VBGR reference 0x04, EXTSINGLE - Single ended external reference 0x05, 2XEXTDIFF - Differential external reference, 2x 0x06, 2XVDD - VFS = 2xAVDD with AVDD as the reference source 0x07, CONF - Use SINGLECTRLX to configure reference

field.name: AT
field.description: Single Channel Acquisition Time - Value, Description 0x00, 1CYCLE - 1 conversion clock cycle acquisition time for single channel 0x01, 2CYCLES - 2 conversion clock cycles acquisition time for single channel 0x02, 3CYCLES - 3 conversion clock cycles acquisition time for single channel 0x03, 4CYCLES - 4 conversion clock cycles acquisition time for single channel 0x04, 8CYCLES - 8 conversion clock cycles acquisition time for single channel 0x05, 16CYCLES - 16 conversion clock cycles acquisition time for single channel 0x06, 32CYCLES - 32 conversion clock cycles acquisition time for single channel 0x07, 64CYCLES - 64 conversion clock cycles acquisition time for single channel 0x08, 128CYCLES - 128 conversion clock cycles acquisition time for single channel 0x09, 256CYCLES - 256 conversion clock cycles acquisition time for single channel

field.name: CMPEN
field.description: Compare Logic Enable for Single Channel

field.name: VREFSEL
field.description: Single Channel Reference Selection - Value, Description 0x00, VBGR - Internal 0.83V Bandgap reference 0x01, VDDXWATT - Scaled AVDD: AVDD*(the VREF attenuation factor) 0x02, VREFPWATT - Scaled singled ended external Vref: ADCn_EXTP*(the VREF attenuation factor) 0x03, VREFP - Raw single ended external Vref: ADCn_EXTP 0x04, VENTROPY - Special mode used to generate ENTROPY. 0x05, VREFPNWATT - Scaled differential external Vref from : (ADCn_EXTP-ADCn_EXTN)*(the VREF attenuation factor) 0x06, VREFPN - Raw differential external Vref from : (ADCn_EXTP-ADCn_EXTN) 0x07, VBGRLOW - Internal Bandgap reference at low setting 0.78V

field.name: VREFATT
field.description: Code for VREF attenuation factor when VREFSEL is 1, 2 or 5

field.name: PRSSEL
field.description: Single Channel PRS Trigger Select - Value, Description 0x00, PRSCH0 - PRS ch 0 triggers single channel 0x01, PRSCH1 - PRS ch 1 triggers single channel 0x02, PRSCH2 - PRS ch 2 triggers single channel 0x03, PRSCH3 - PRS ch 3 triggers single channel 0x04, PRSCH4 - PRS ch 4 triggers single channel 0x05, PRSCH5 - PRS ch 5 triggers single channel 0x06, PRSCH6 - PRS ch 6 triggers single channel 0x07, PRSCH7 - PRS ch 7 triggers single channel 0x08, PRSCH8 - PRS ch 8 triggers single channel 0x09, PRSCH9 - PRS ch 9 triggers single channel 0x0A, PRSCH10 - PRS ch 10 triggers single channel 0x0B, PRSCH11 - PRS ch 11 triggers single channel

field.name: CONVSTARTDELAY
field.description: Delay value for next conversion start if CONVSTARTDELAYEN is set.

field.name: REPDELAY
field.description: REPDELAY select for SINGLE REP mode - Value, Description 0x00, NODELAY - No delay 0x01, 4CYCLES - 4 conversion clock cycles 0x02, 8CYCLES - 8 conversion clock cycles 0x03, 16CYCLES - 16 conversion clock cycles 0x04, 32CYCLES - 32 conversion clock cycles 0x05, 64CYCLES - 64 conversion clock cycles 0x06, 128CYCLES - 128 conversion clock cycles 0x07, 256CYCLES - 256 conversion clock cycles

field.name: RES
field.description: Scan Sequence Resolution Select - Value, Description 0x00, 12BIT - 12-bit resolution 0x01, 8BIT - 8-bit resolution 0x02, 6BIT - 6-bit resolution 0x03, OVS - Oversampling enabled. Oversampling rate is set in OVSRSEL

field.name: REF
field.description: Scan Sequence Reference Selection - Value, Description 0x00, 1V25 - VFS = 1.25V with internal VBGR reference 0x01, 2V5 - VFS = 2.5V with internal VBGR reference 0x02, VDD - VFS = AVDD with AVDD as reference source 0x03, 5V - VFS = 5V with internal VBGR reference 0x04, EXTSINGLE - Single ended external reference 0x05, 2XEXTDIFF - Differential external reference, 2x 0x06, 2XVDD - VFS=2xAVDD with AVDD as the reference source 0x07, CONF - Use SCANCTRLX to configure reference

field.name: AT
field.description: Scan Acquisition Time - Value, Description 0x00, 1CYCLE - 1 conversion clock cycle acquisition time for scan 0x01, 2CYCLES - 2 conversion clock cycles acquisition time for scan 0x02, 3CYCLES - 3 conversion clock cycles acquisition time for scan 0x03, 4CYCLES - 4 conversion clock cycles acquisition time for scan 0x04, 8CYCLES - 8 conversion clock cycles acquisition time for scan 0x05, 16CYCLES - 16 conversion clock cycles acquisition time for scan 0x06, 32CYCLES - 32 conversion clock cycles acquisition time for scan 0x07, 64CYCLES - 64 conversion clock cycles acquisition time for scan 0x08, 128CYCLES - 128 conversion clock cycles acquisition time for scan 0x09, 256CYCLES - 256 conversion clock cycles acquisition time for scan

field.name: VREFSEL
field.description: Scan Channel Reference Selection - Value, Description 0x00, VBGR - Internal 0.83V Bandgap reference 0x01, VDDXWATT - Scaled AVDD: AVDD*(the VREF attenuation factor) 0x02, VREFPWATT - Scaled singled ended external Vref: ADCn_EXTP*(the VREF attenuation factor) 0x03, VREFP - Raw single ended external Vref: ADCn_EXTP 0x05, VREFPNWATT - Scaled differential external Vref from : (ADCn_EXTP-ADCn_EXTN)*(the VREF attenuation factor) 0x06, VREFPN - Raw differential external Vref from : (ADCn_EXTP-ADCn_EXTN) 0x07, VBGRLOW - Internal Bandgap reference at low setting 0.78V

field.name: VREFATT
field.description: Code for VREF attenuation factor when VREFSEL is 1, 2 or 5

field.name: OFFSETP
field.description: OPAx Non-Inverting Input Offset Configuration Value.

field.name: OFFSETN
field.description: OPAx Inverting Input Offset Configuration Value.

field.name: CM
field.description: CSEN Conversion Mode Select. - Value, Description 0x00, SGL - Single Channel Mode: One conversion of a single channel (when MCE = 0) or set of bonded channels (when MCE = 1) per conversion trigger. 0x01, SCAN - Scan Mode: Scans multiple selected channels once per conversion trigger. 0x02, CONTSGL - Continuous Single Channel: Continuous conversion of a single channel (when MCE = 0) or set of bonded channels (when MCE = 1). 0x03, CONTSCAN - Continuous Scan Mode: Continuously scans multiple selected channels.

field.name: SARCR
field.description: SAR Conversion Resolution. - Value, Description 0x00, CLK10 - Conversions last 10 internal CSEN clocks and are 10-bits in length. 0x01, CLK12 - Conversions last 12 internal CSEN clocks and are 12-bits in length. 0x02, CLK14 - Conversions last 14 internal CSEN clocks and are 14-bits in length. 0x03, CLK16 - Conversions last 16 internal CSEN clocks and are 16-bits in length.

field.name: ACU
field.description: CSEN Accumulator Mode Select. - Value, Description 0x00, ACC1 - Accumulate 1 sample. 0x01, ACC2 - Accumulate 2 sample. 0x02, ACC4 - Accumulate 4 sample. 0x03, ACC8 - Accumulate 8 sample. 0x04, ACC16 - Accumulate 16 sample. 0x05, ACC32 - Accumulate 32 sample. 0x06, ACC64 - Accumulate 64 sample.

field.name: STM
field.description: Start Trigger Select - Value, Description 0x00, PRS - PRS Triggering. Conversions are triggered by the PRS channel selected in PRSSEL. 0x01, TIMER - Timer Triggering. Conversions are triggered by a local CSEN timer reload. 0x02, START - Software Triggering. Conversions are triggered by writing a 1 to the START field of the CMD register.

field.name: EMACMPEN
field.description: Greater and less than comparison using the exponential moving average (EMA) is enabled.

field.name: PCPRESC
